verses.verse: Every wise <WH2454> woman <WH802> builds <WH1129> her house: <WH1004> but the foolish <WH200> plucks <WH2040> it down <WH8045> with her hands. <WH3027>
He that walks <WH1980> in his uprightness <WH3476> fears <WH3373> the LORD: <WH3068> but he that is perverse <WH3868> in his ways <WH1870> despises <WH959> him.
In the mouth <WH6310> of the foolish <WH191> is a rod <WH2415> of pride: <WH1346> but the lips <WH8193> of the wise <WH2450> shall preserve <WH8104> them.
Where no <WH369> oxen <WH504> are, the crib <WH18> is clean: <WH1249> but much <WH7230> increase <WH8393> is by the strength <WH3581> of the ox. <WH7794>
A faithful <WH529> witness <WH5707> will not lie: <WH3576> but a false <WH8267> witness <WH5707> will utter <WH6315> lies. <WH3576>
A scorner <WH3887> seeks <WH1245> wisdom, <WH2451> and finds it not: but knowledge <WH1847> is easy <WH7043> to him that understands. <WH995>
Go <WH3212> from the presence <WH5048> of a foolish <WH3684> man, <WH376> when you perceive <WH3045> not in him the lips <WH8193> of knowledge. <WH1847>
The wisdom <WH2451> of the prudent <WH6175> is to understand <WH995> his way: <WH1870> but the folly <WH200> of fools <WH3684> is deceit. <WH4820>
Fools <WH191> make a mock <WH3887> at sin: <WH817> but among <WH996> the righteous <WH3477> there is favor. <WH7522>
The heart <WH3820> knows <WH3045> his own <WH5315> bitterness; <WH4751> and a stranger <WH2114> does not intermeddle <WH6148> with his joy. <WH8057>
The house <WH1004> of the wicked <WH7563> shall be overthrown: <WH8045> but the tabernacle <WH168> of the upright <WH3477> shall flourish. <WH6524>
There is a way <WH1870> which seems <WH6440> right <WH3477> to a man, <WH376> but the end <WH319> thereof are the ways <WH1870> of death. <WH4194>
Even <WH1571> in laughter <WH7814> the heart <WH3820> is sorrowful; <WH3510> and the end <WH319> of that mirth <WH8057> is heaviness. <WH8424>
The backslider <WH5472> in heart <WH3820> shall be filled <WH7646> with his own ways: <WH1870> and a good <WH2896> man <WH376> shall be satisfied from himself.
The simple <WH6612> believes <WH539> every <WH3605> word: <WH1697> but the prudent <WH6175> man looks <WH995> well <WH995> to his going. <WH838>
A wise <WH2450> man fears, <WH3373> and departs <WH5493> from evil: <WH7451> but the fool <WH3684> rages, <WH5674> and is confident. <WH982>
He that is soon <WH7116> angry <WH639> deals <WH6213> foolishly: <WH200> and a man <WH376> of wicked <WH4209> devices <WH4209> is hated. <WH8130>
The simple <WH6612> inherit <WH5157> folly: <WH200> but the prudent <WH6175> are crowned <WH3803> with knowledge. <WH1847>
The evil <WH7451> bow <WH7817> before <WH6440> the good; <WH2896> and the wicked <WH7563> at <WH5921> the gates <WH8179> of the righteous. <WH6662>
The poor <WH7326> is hated <WH8130> even <WH1571> of his own neighbor: <WH7453> but the rich <WH6223> has many <WH7227> friends. <WH157>
He that despises <WH936> his neighbor <WH7453> sins: <WH2398> but he that has mercy <WH2603> on the poor, <WH6035> <WH6041> happy <WH835> is he.
Do they not err <WH8582> that devise <WH2790> evil? <WH7451> but mercy <WH2617> and truth <WH571> shall be to them that devise <WH2790> good. <WH2896>
In all <WH3605> labor <WH6089> there is profit: <WH4195> but the talk <WH1697> of the lips <WH8193> tends only <WH389> to penury. <WH4270>
The crown <WH5850> of the wise <WH2450> is their riches: <WH6239> but the foolishness <WH200> of fools <WH3684> is folly. <WH200>
A true <WH571> witness <WH5707> delivers <WH5337> souls: <WH5315> but a deceitful <WH4820> witness speaks <WH6315> lies. <WH3576>
In the fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068> is strong <WH5797> confidence: <WH4009> and his children <WH1121> shall have <WH1961> a place of refuge. <WH4268>
The fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068> is a fountain <WH4726> of life, <WH2416> to depart <WH5493> from the snares <WH4170> of death. <WH4194>
In the multitude <WH7230> of people <WH5971> is the king's <WH4428> honor: <WH1927> but in the want <WH657> of people <WH3816> is the destruction <WH4288> of the prince. <WH7333>
He that is slow <WH750> to wrath <WH639> is of great <WH7227> understanding: <WH8394> but he that is hasty <WH7116> of spirit <WH7307> exalts <WH7311> folly. <WH200>
A sound <WH4832> heart <WH3820> is the life <WH2416> of the flesh: <WH1320> but envy <WH7068> the rottenness <WH7538> of the bones. <WH6106>
He that oppresses <WH6231> the poor <WH1800> reproaches <WH2778> his Maker: <WH6213> but he that honors <WH3513> him has mercy <WH2603> on the poor. <WH34>
The wicked <WH7563> is driven <WH1760> away in his wickedness: <WH7451> but the righteous <WH6662> has hope <WH2620> in his death. <WH4194>
Wisdom <WH2451> rests <WH5117> in the heart <WH3820> of him that has understanding: <WH995> but that which is in the middle <WH7130> of fools <WH3684> is made known. <WH3045>
Righteousness <WH6666> exalts <WH7311> a nation: <WH1471> but sin <WH2403> is a reproach <WH2617> to any people. <WH3816>
The king's <WH4428> favor <WH7522> is toward a wise <WH7919> servant: <WH5650> but his wrath <WH5678> is against him that causes shame. <WH954>
